p: The single yellowish green spot appeared when TLC plate was developed with anisaldehyde reagent. This confirmed the presence of glycolipid type BS with an R f value of 0.77 ( Figure 4A). The R f values of di-rhamnolipids were noted as 0.41 (first spot) and 0.71 (second spot). The thin layer chromatograms performed to detect the presence of sugar, displayed single spot with R f value of 0.8 which did not match with any of the reference sugars included in the experiment. The R f value for RHL was found to be 0.7. TLC plate developed with iodine crystals showed five spots of RHL (0.6), linoleic acid (0.3), cholesterol (0.4), dipalmitin (0.6), oleic acid (0.6), and tripalmitate (0.9). The TLC plate developed with 0.2% ninhydrin reagent did not display the presence of any amino acids, confirming the sugar and lipid moieties in a BS formed by P. maritimus SAMP.
